text: IV .
text_tokenized: IV .

text: When Jane and Elizabeth were alone , the former , who had been cautious in her praise of Mr. Bingley before , expressed to her sister how very much she admired him .
text_tokenized: When Jane and Elizabeth were alone , the former , who had been cautious in her praise of Mr. Bingley before , expressed to her sister how very much she admired him .

text: “ He is just what a young - man ought to be , ” said she , “ sensible , good - humoured , lively ; and I never saw such happy manners ! so much ease , with such perfect good breeding ! ” “ He is also handsome , ” replied Elizabeth , “ which a young man ought likewise to be if he possibly can .
text_tokenized: “ He is just what a young - man ought to be , ” said she , “ sensible , good - humoured , lively ; and I never saw such happy manners ! so much ease , with such perfect good breeding ! ” “ He is also handsome , ” replied Elizabeth , “ which a young man ought likewise to be if he possibly can .

text_tokenized: But that is one great difference between us .

text: Compliments always take _ you _ by surprise , and _ me _ never .

text: You have liked many a stupider person . ”
text_tokenized: You have liked many a stupider person . ”

text: “ Dear Lizzy ! ” “ Oh , you are a great deal too apt , you know , to like people in general .
text_tokenized: “ Dear Lizzy ! ” “ Oh , you are a great deal too apt , you know , to like people in general .

text: You never see a fault in anybody .
text_tokenized: You never see a fault in anybody .

text: All the world are good and agreeable in your eyes .
text_tokenized: All the world are good and agreeable in your eyes .

text: I never heard you speak ill of a human being in my life . ”
text_tokenized: I never heard you speak ill of a human being in my life . ”

text: “ I would wish not to be hasty in censuring anyone ; but I always speak what I think . ”
text_tokenized: “ I would wish not to be hasty in censuring anyone ; but I always speak what I think . ”

text: “ I know you do : and it is _ that _ which makes the wonder .
text_tokenized: “ I know you do : and it is _ that _ which makes the wonder .

text: With _ your _ good sense , to be so honestly blind to the follies and nonsense of others !
text_tokenized: With _ your _ good sense , to be so honestly blind to the follies and nonsense of others !

text: Affectation of candour is common enough ; one meets with it everywhere .
text_tokenized: Affectation of candour is common enough ; one meets with it everywhere .

text: But to be candid without ostentation or design,--to take the good of everybody ’s character and make it still better , and say nothing of the bad,--belongs to you alone .
text_tokenized: But to be candid without ostentation or design,--to take the good of everybody ’s character and make it still better , and say nothing of the bad,--belongs to you alone .

text: And so , you like this man ’s sisters , too , do you ?
text_tokenized: And so , you like this man ’s sisters , too , do you ?

text: Their manners are not equal to his . ”
text_tokenized: Their manners are not equal to his . ”

text: “ Certainly not , at first ; but they are very pleasing women when you converse with them .
text_tokenized: “ Certainly not , at first ; but they are very pleasing women when you converse with them .

text: Miss Bingley is to live with her brother , and keep his house ; and I am much mistaken if we shall not find a very charming neighbour in her .
text_tokenized: Miss Bingley is to live with her brother , and keep his house ; and I am much mistaken if we shall not find a very charming neighbour in her .

text: Elizabeth listened in silence , but was not convinced : their behaviour at the assembly had not been calculated to please in general ; and with more quickness of observation and less pliancy of temper than her sister , and with a judgment , too , unassailed by any attention to herself , she was very little disposed to approve them .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth listened in silence , but was not convinced : their behaviour at the assembly had not been calculated to please in general ; and with more quickness of observation and less pliancy of temper than her sister , and with a judgment , too , unassailed by any attention to herself , she was very little disposed to approve them .

text: They were , in fact , very fine ladies ; not deficient in good - humour when they were pleased , nor in the power of being agreeable where they chose it ; but proud and conceited .
text_tokenized: They were , in fact , very fine ladies ; not deficient in good - humour when they were pleased , nor in the power of being agreeable where they chose it ; but proud and conceited .

text: They were rather handsome ; had been educated in one of the first private seminaries in town ; had a fortune of twenty thousand pounds ; were in the habit of spending more than they ought , and of associating with people of rank ; and were , therefore , in every respect entitled to think well of themselves and meanly of others .
text_tokenized: They were rather handsome ; had been educated in one of the first private seminaries in town ; had a fortune of twenty thousand pounds ; were in the habit of spending more than they ought , and of associating with people of rank ; and were , therefore , in every respect entitled to think well of themselves and meanly of others .

text: They were of a respectable family in the north of England ; a circumstance more deeply impressed on their memories than that their brother ’s fortune and their own had been acquired by trade .
text_tokenized: They were of a respectable family in the north of England ; a circumstance more deeply impressed on their memories than that their brother ’s fortune and their own had been acquired by trade .

text: Mr. Bingley inherited property to the amount of nearly a hundred thousand pounds from his father , who had intended to purchase an estate , but did not live to do it .
text_tokenized: Mr. Bingley inherited property to the amount of nearly a hundred thousand pounds from his father , who had intended to purchase an estate , but did not live to do it .

text: Mr. Bingley intended it likewise , and sometimes made choice of his county ; but , as he was now provided with a good house and the liberty of a manor , it was doubtful to many of those who best knew the easiness of his temper , whether he might not spend the remainder of his days at Netherfield , and leave the next generation to purchase
text_tokenized: Mr. Bingley intended it likewise , and sometimes made choice of his county ; but , as he was now provided with a good house and the liberty of a manor , it was doubtful to many of those who best knew the easiness of his temper , whether he might not spend the remainder of his days at Netherfield , and leave the next generation to purchase

text: His sisters were very anxious for his having an estate of his own ; but though he was now established only as a tenant , Miss Bingley was by no means unwilling to preside at his table ; nor was Mrs. Hurst , who had married a man of more fashion than fortune , less disposed to consider his house as her home when it suited her .
text_tokenized: His sisters were very anxious for his having an estate of his own ; but though he was now established only as a tenant , Miss Bingley was by no means unwilling to preside at his table ; nor was Mrs. Hurst , who had married a man of more fashion than fortune , less disposed to consider his house as her home when it suited her .

text: Mr. Bingley had not been of age two years when he was tempted , by an accidental recommendation , to look at Netherfield House .
text_tokenized: Mr. Bingley had not been of age two years when he was tempted , by an accidental recommendation , to look at Netherfield House .

text: He did look at it , and into it , for half an hour ; was pleased with the situation and the principal rooms , satisfied with what the owner said in its praise , and took it immediately .
text_tokenized: He did look at it , and into it , for half an hour ; was pleased with the situation and the principal rooms , satisfied with what the owner said in its praise , and took it immediately .

text: Between him and Darcy there was a very steady friendship , in spite of a great opposition of character .
text_tokenized: Between him and Darcy there was a very steady friendship , in spite of a great opposition of character .

text: Bingley was endeared to Darcy by the easiness , openness , and ductility of his temper , though no disposition could offer a greater contrast to his own , and though with his own he never appeared dissatisfied .
text_tokenized: Bingley was endeared to Darcy by the easiness , openness , and ductility of his temper , though no disposition could offer a greater contrast to his own , and though with his own he never appeared dissatisfied .

text: On the strength of Darcy ’s regard , Bingley had the firmest reliance , and of his judgment the highest opinion .
text_tokenized: On the strength of Darcy ’s regard , Bingley had the firmest reliance , and of his judgment the highest opinion .

text: In understanding , Darcy was the superior .
text_tokenized: In understanding , Darcy was the superior .

text: Bingley was by no means deficient ; but Darcy was clever .
text_tokenized: Bingley was by no means deficient ; but Darcy was clever .

text: He was at the same time haughty , reserved , and fastidious ; and his manners , though well bred , were not inviting .
text_tokenized: He was at the same time haughty , reserved , and fastidious ; and his manners , though well bred , were not inviting .

text: In that respect his friend had greatly the advantage .
text_tokenized: In that respect his friend had greatly the advantage .

text: Bingley was sure of being liked wherever he appeared ; Darcy was continually giving offence .
text_tokenized: Bingley was sure of being liked wherever he appeared ; Darcy was continually giving offence .

text: The manner in which they spoke of the Meryton assembly was sufficiently characteristic .
text_tokenized: The manner in which they spoke of the Meryton assembly was sufficiently characteristic .

text: Bingley had never met with pleasanter people or prettier girls in his life ; everybody had been most kind and attentive to him ; there had been no formality , no stiffness ; he had soon felt acquainted with all the room ; and as to Miss Bennet , he could not conceive an angel more beautiful .
text_tokenized: Bingley had never met with pleasanter people or prettier girls in his life ; everybody had been most kind and attentive to him ; there had been no formality , no stiffness ; he had soon felt acquainted with all the room ; and as to Miss Bennet , he could not conceive an angel more beautiful .

text: Darcy , on the contrary , had seen a collection of people in whom there was little beauty and no fashion , for none of whom he had felt the smallest interest , and from none received either attention or pleasure .
text_tokenized: Darcy , on the contrary , had seen a collection of people in whom there was little beauty and no fashion , for none of whom he had felt the smallest interest , and from none received either attention or pleasure .

text: Miss Bennet he acknowledged to be pretty ; but she smiled too much .
text_tokenized: Miss Bennet he acknowledged to be pretty ; but she smiled too much .

text: Mrs. Hurst and her sister allowed it to be so ; but still they admired her and liked her , and pronounced her to be a sweet girl , and one whom they should not object to know more of .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Hurst and her sister allowed it to be so ; but still they admired her and liked her , and pronounced her to be a sweet girl , and one whom they should not object to know more of .

text: Miss Bennet was therefore established as a sweet girl ; and their brother felt authorized by such commendation to think of her as he chose .
text_tokenized: Miss Bennet was therefore established as a sweet girl ; and their brother felt authorized by such commendation to think of her as he chose .

text: V.
text_tokenized: V.

text: Within a short walk of Longbourn lived a family with whom the Bennets were particularly intimate .
text_tokenized: Within a short walk of Longbourn lived a family with whom the Bennets were particularly intimate .

text: Sir William Lucas had been formerly in trade in Meryton , where he had made a tolerable fortune , and risen to the honour of knighthood by an address to the king during his mayoralty .
text_tokenized: Sir William Lucas had been formerly in trade in Meryton , where he had made a tolerable fortune , and risen to the honour of knighthood by an address to the king during his mayoralty .

text: The distinction had , perhaps , been felt too strongly .
text_tokenized: The distinction had , perhaps , been felt too strongly .

text: It had given him a disgust to his business and to his residence in a small market town ; and , quitting them both , he had removed with his family to a house about a mile from Meryton , denominated from that period Lucas Lodge ; where he could think with pleasure of his own importance , and , unshackled by business , occupy himself solely in being civil to all the world .
text_tokenized: It had given him a disgust to his business and to his residence in a small market town ; and , quitting them both , he had removed with his family to a house about a mile from Meryton , denominated from that period Lucas Lodge ; where he could think with pleasure of his own importance , and , unshackled by business , occupy himself solely in being civil to all the world .

text: For , though elated by his rank , it did not render him supercilious ; on the contrary , he was all attention to everybody .
text_tokenized: For , though elated by his rank , it did not render him supercilious ; on the contrary , he was all attention to everybody .

text: By nature inoffensive , friendly , and obliging , his presentation at St. James ’s had made him courteous .
text_tokenized: By nature inoffensive , friendly , and obliging , his presentation at St. James ’s had made him courteous .

text: Lady Lucas was a very good kind of woman , not too clever to be a valuable neighbour to Mrs. Bennet .
text_tokenized: Lady Lucas was a very good kind of woman , not too clever to be a valuable neighbour to Mrs. Bennet .

text: They had several children .
text_tokenized: They had several children .

text: The eldest of them , a sensible , intelligent young woman , about twenty - seven , was Elizabeth ’s intimate friend .
text_tokenized: The eldest of them , a sensible , intelligent young woman , about twenty - seven , was Elizabeth ’s intimate friend .

text: That the Miss Lucases and the Miss Bennets should meet to talk over a ball was absolutely necessary ; and the morning after the assembly brought the former to Longbourn to hear and to communicate .
text_tokenized: That the Miss Lucases and the Miss Bennets should meet to talk over a ball was absolutely necessary ; and the morning after the assembly brought the former to Longbourn to hear and to communicate .

text: “ _ You _ began the evening well , Charlotte , ” said Mrs. Bennet , with civil self - command , to Miss Lucas .

text: “ _ You _ were Mr. Bingley ’s first choice . ”
text_tokenized: “ _ You _ were Mr. Bingley ’s first choice . ”

text_tokenized: “ Yes ; but he seemed to like his second better . ” “ Oh , you mean Jane , I suppose , because he danced with her twice .

text_tokenized: To be sure that _ did _ seem as if he admired her

text: Mr. Robinson ’s asking him how he liked our Meryton assemblies , and whether he did not think there were a great many pretty women in the room , and _ which _ he thought the prettiest ? and his answering immediately to the last question , ‘ Oh , the eldest Miss Bennet , beyond a doubt : there can not be two opinions on that point . ’ ”

text: “ Mr. Darcy is not so well worth listening to as his friend , is he ?

text_tokenized: “ Ay , because she asked him at last how he liked Netherfield , and he could not help answering her ; but she said he seemed very angry at being spoke to . ”

text: “ Miss Bingley told me , ” said Jane , “ that he never speaks much unless among his intimate acquaintance .

text: “ I do not believe a word of it , my dear .
text_tokenized: “ I do not believe a word of it , my dear .

text_tokenized: If he had been so very agreeable , he would have talked to Mrs. Long .

text: But I can guess how it was ; everybody says that he is eat up with pride , and I dare say he had heard somehow that Mrs. Long does not keep a carriage , and had to come to the ball in a hack chaise .
text_tokenized: But I can guess how it was ; everybody says that he is eat up with pride , and I dare say he had heard somehow that Mrs. Long does not keep a carriage , and had to come to the ball in a hack chaise .

text: “ I do not mind his not talking to Mrs. Long , ” said Miss Lucas , “ but I wish he had danced with Eliza . ”
text_tokenized: “ I do not mind his not talking to Mrs. Long , ” said Miss Lucas , “ but I wish he had danced with Eliza . ”

text: “ Another time , Lizzy , ” said her mother , “ I would not dance with _ him _ , if I were you . ”
text_tokenized: “ Another time , Lizzy , ” said her mother , “ I would not dance with _ him _ , if I were you . ”

text: “ I believe , ma’am , I may safely promise you _ never _ to dance with him . ”
text_tokenized: “ I believe , ma’am , I may safely promise you _ never _ to dance with him . ”

text: “ His pride , ” said Miss Lucas , “ does not offend _ me _ so much as pride often does , because there is an excuse for it .
text_tokenized: “ His pride , ” said Miss Lucas , “ does not offend _ me _ so much as pride often does , because there is an excuse for it .

text: One can not wonder that so very fine a young man , with family , fortune , everything in his favour , should think highly of himself .
text_tokenized: One can not wonder that so very fine a young man , with family , fortune , everything in his favour , should think highly of himself .

text: If I may so express it , he has a _ right _ to be proud . ”
text_tokenized: If I may so express it , he has a _ right _ to be proud . ”

text: “ That is very true , ” replied Elizabeth , “ and I could easily forgive _ his _ pride , if he had not mortified _ mine _ . ”
text_tokenized: “ That is very true , ” replied Elizabeth , “ and I could easily forgive _ his _ pride , if he had not mortified _ mine _ . ”

text: “ Pride , ” observed Mary , who piqued herself upon the solidity of her reflections , “ is a very common failing , I believe .
text_tokenized: “ Pride , ” observed Mary , who piqued herself upon the solidity of her reflections , “ is a very common failing , I believe .

text: By all that I have ever read , I am convinced that it is very common indeed ; that human nature is particularly prone to it , and that there are very few of us who do not cherish a feeling of self - complacency on the score of some quality or other , real or imaginary .
text_tokenized: By all that I have ever read , I am convinced that it is very common indeed ; that human nature is particularly prone to it , and that there are very few of us who do not cherish a feeling of self - complacency on the score of some quality or other , real or imaginary .

text: Vanity and pride are different things , though the words are often used synonymously .
text_tokenized: Vanity and pride are different things , though the words are often used synonymously .

text: A person may be proud without being vain .
text_tokenized: A person may be proud without being vain .

text: Pride relates more to our opinion of ourselves
text_tokenized: Pride relates more to our opinion of ourselves

text: ; vanity to what we would have others think of us .
text_tokenized: ; vanity to what we would have others think of us .

text: ” “ If I were as rich as Mr. Darcy , ” cried a young Lucas , who came with his sisters , “ I should not care how proud I was .
text_tokenized: ” “ If I were as rich as Mr. Darcy , ” cried a young Lucas , who came with his sisters , “ I should not care how proud I was .

text: I would keep a pack of foxhounds , and drink a bottle of wine every day .
text_tokenized: I would keep a pack of foxhounds , and drink a bottle of wine every day .

text: “ Then you would drink a great deal more than you ought , ” said Mrs. Bennet ; “ and if I were to see you at it , I should take away your bottle directly .

text: The boy protested that she should not ; she continued to declare that she would ; and the argument ended only with the visit .
